entries.title: Kurds killed in Paris: The 10th district mourns the victims in silent march
entries.description: Several hundred people marched on Monday midday from rue d'Enghien to rue La Fayette to pay tribute to the three Kurdish activists shot dead on Friday. Among them, many Kurds, and the occasional French people who came to show their support.

entries.title: Japan redesigns energy future by prioritizing nuclear power
entries.description: By fast-tracking the revival of existing reactors and the construction of new units, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is reneging on the commitment he made after the Fukushima disaster to abandon nuclear energy.

entries.title: Ukraine eyes peace summit in February
entries.description: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba told Associated Press his government was aiming to have a peace summit by the end of February, preferably at the United Nations.

entries.title: 'The Patient' on Disney+ : Life meets death in therapy
entries.description: The creators of 'The Americans' return with a miniseries that features Steve Carell as a therapist held captive by a serial killer.

entries.title: The Russian drone war, from Syria to Ukraine
entries.description: Russia incorporated Iranian drones into its Syria campaign back in 2015 and today they are also devastating Ukraine.

entries.title: Hundreds march in Paris in tribute to Kurds killings
entries.description: Monday's march also commemorates the anniversary of a triple murder of Kurdish militants which happened ten years ago in the same Paris area.

entries.title: China to scrap quarantine for overseas arrivals
entries.description: China said it would scrap mandatory quarantine on arrival starting January 8, further unwinding years of strict virus controls as the country battles a surge in cases.

entries.title: War alters Kharkiv Christmas celebrations
entries.description: For the first time this year, the Orthodox Church in Ukraine celebrated the Nativity on December 25, breaking with the calendar of the Moscow Patriarchate which celebrates on January 7.

entries.title: Storm deaths rise to 25 in western New York county
entries.description: The new figure brings the nationwide death toll related to the days-long storm to 47 people across nine states.

entries.title: In Mali, jihadists showcase strength at expense of civilians
entries.description: Civilians are paying a high price as Malian authorities are failing on a promise to regain control of jihadist strongholds.

entries.title: Ukraine calls for Russia's removal from UN
entries.description: In a statement on Monday, Ukraine's foreign ministry said Russia was usurping the USSR's seat at the United Nations Security Council.

entries.title: Eight dead in Islamic State prison assault in Syria
entries.description: The attack targeted a Kurdish security complex housing hundreds of jihadists in Raqa.

entries.title: Kyiv accuses Moscow of supplying Syria with wheat stolen from Ukraine
entries.description: Since the start of the war in Syria in 2011, the country has increased its imports to compensate for a decline in local production.

entries.title: In Afghanistan, women employees of NGOs banned despite enormous humanitarian needs
entries.description: The Taliban have banned women from working for NGOs operating in the country, where 28 million people out of 39 million require humanitarian assistance.

entries.title: The top 20 articles you've read this year
entries.description: A mix of hard news, lighter pieces and all things French: Here are the stories you've most enjoyed this year.

entries.title: Kamikaze bacteria sacrifice themselves for the community
entries.description: Researchers at the University of Montreal have discovered that some individuals in colonies commit suicide when conditions deteriorate. By indicating to others that it is time to flee, they save the group.

entries.title: An immersive experience into the heart of Chanel's iconic perfume
entries.description: Until January 9, the famous fashion house is presenting its 'Grand Numéro' at the Grand Palais Ephémère, in Paris, an exhibition that smells as good as it looks.

entries.title: We cannot abandon the women of Afghanistan
entries.description: The Taliban are waging a relentless social war in which women are both targets and victims.

entries.title: Seoul fired warning shots after 'North Korea drone incursion'
entries.description: South Korea accused the North of flying 'several' drones across their shared border, prompting Seoul's military to deploy warplanes and fire warning shots.

entries.title: French Christmas rail strikes: The lessons of an industrial action without unions
entries.description: The non-union strike of ticket inspectors marks a turning point in the history of industrial action against the SNCF state-owned railroad group.

entries.title: Paris shooting suspect admits 'pathological hatred of foreigners'
entries.description: In police custody, William M. said he was driven by a 'hatred of foreigners that has become completely pathological' since a burglary at his home in 2016.

entries.title: France's Kurdish community is haunted by Ankara's violence
entries.description: Friday's murderous attack in Paris has aroused the anger of the Kurdish community against the French state, accused of not having protected it.

entries.title: Ukrainian drone reaches Russian air base, three killed
entries.description: The base targeted in the attack is located more than 600 kilometers from Ukraine.

entries.title: Influencers consider a costly climate conversion
entries.description: Between individual awareness and pressure from activists denouncing their lifestyle, a small minority of content creators are undertaking a green shift.

entries.title: Kenya looks to genetically-modified maize to combat food crisis
entries.description: President William Ruto's unilateral decision to reverse a 2012 ban on imports of GM maize is met with resistance and outcry within the country.

entries.title: Elon Musk's Starlink and the battle of satellite constellations
entries.description: 'Race to the stars' (1/4). The war in Ukraine has revealed the importance of broadcasting high-speed internet through space when terrestrial infrastructure is destroyed or non-existent. In this emerging market, a host of projects, including those by Amazon and Eutelsat, are competing with Mr. Musk's satellites.

entries.title: In Senegal, Chanel breathes new life into Dakar's old courthouse
entries.description: The French couture house held the first ever luxury-brand fashion show in sub-Saharan Africa, cementing Dakar's new status as a dynamic and attractive cultural center.

entries.title: In the United States, manufacturing is back
entries.description: In recent months, the US manufacturing sector has experienced a rebound not seen since the 1980s in the face of supply chain delays and geopolitical risks in China.

entries.title: China deploys 47 warplanes across Taiwan's air defense zone
entries.description: China said it conducted the 'strike drill' in response to unspecified 'provocations' and 'collusion' between the United States and the self-ruled island.

entries.title: Serbia deploys military chief to Kosovo border amid rising tensions
entries.description: As strained relations between the two countries were exacerbated by recent blockades, Belgrade is preparing to send troops to the border.
